title: Africacult
creator_credit: Philip Gaunt, Sam Kofi Bryan, Unesco and Ghana Film Industry Corporation
brief_description: The traditional culture of the Ashantis of Ghana goes back hundreds of years but is still very much alive. A “durbar” called by the Ashanti king brings the whole people together for the first time in twenty-two years and shows that cultural identity can be a powerful force for unity in this country.
